intro: Ulmus minor, commonly known as the field elm, is a deciduous tree native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a broad, spreading crown. The leaves are heart-shaped, with a rough texture and a serrated margin. Its bark is smooth and grayish, becoming fissured with age. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by small, round fruits.
